title: British HC recommends Sri Lankan MPs learn from UK system to curb corruption
byline: The British High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Andrew Patrick has expressed eagerness to further strengthen the strong bilateral ties between Sri Lanka and the United Kingdom.

title: Fairly heavy showers likely in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern and North-Central Provinces and in Puttalam and Trincomalee districts today (07).

title: Rice shortage, price surge fueled by increased beer production?
byline: The Small and Medium Scale Rice Mill Owners’ Association stresses that the growing rice shortage in the market is caused by the increased use of raw rice for beer production.

title: Deadline for surrendering licensed firearms extended
byline: The Ministry of Defence has extended the period granted to surrender all licensed firearms issued to civilians until November 21, 2024.

title: General Election campaigning ends on Monday
byline: The election campaigning activities for the 2024 General Election are scheduled to end at midnight on Monday (Nov. 11).

title: Biden rushing assistance to Ukraine, with aid uncertain under Trump
byline: The White House plans to rush billions of dollars in security assistance to Ukraine before President Joe Biden leaves office in January, sources said on Wednesday, hoping to shore up the government in Kyiv before President-elect Donald Trump’s Jan. 20 inauguration.

title: 50,000 foreign cigarettes and 210 liquor bottles seized in Pettah
byline: Police have arrested a suspect along with a stock of illegally imported foreign liquor bottles and cigarettes at Third Cross Street in Pettah on Wednesday (06).

title: Australia plans social media ban for under-16s
byline: Australia’s government says it will introduce “world-leading” legislation to ban children under 16 from social media.

title: Germany faces snap election as Scholz’s coalition crumbles
byline: Germany’s ruling coalition collapsed on Wednesday as Chancellor Olaf Scholz sacked his finance minister and paved the way for a snap election, triggering political chaos in Europe’s largest economy hours after Donald Trump won the U.S. presidential election.

title: Sri Lanka crowned ‘Most Desirable Island in the World’
byline: Sri Lanka has been voted the Most Desirable Island in the World at the Wanderlust Reader Travel Awards 2024 in London.

title: Lohan Ratwatte and wife produced before court
byline: Former Minister of State Lohan Ratwatte and his wife, who were arrested and remanded over the charges of using a luxury car illegally imported and assembled in Sri Lanka, were produced before the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court today (07).

title: General Election sees low campaign turnout, declined political engagement - PAFFREL
byline: The Executive Director of the People’s Action for Free and Fair Elections (PAFFREL) Rohana Hettiarachchi says that despite 8,888 candidates vying for positions in this year’s General Election, fewer than 1,000 are actively campaigning, reflecting a notable decline in political engagement.

title: Police find another illegally assembled luxury car belonging to a ‘Kapuwa’
byline: Another illegally assembled luxury car has been found in the garage of a ‘Kapuwa’, who was previously arrested over similar charges related to the possession of an illegally assembled vehicle.

title: Lohan Ratwatte and wife further remanded
byline: Former Minister Lohan Ratwatte and his wife have been ordered to be remanded further until November 18 by the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: After Salman Khan, Shah Rukh Khan gets death threat
byline: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan has received a death threat, according to Bandra Police, in Maharashtra’s Mumbai. The threat was received from a number registered in the name of a man named Faizan from Chhattisgarh’s Raipur. Shah Rukh Khan’s team has registered a complaint with the Bandra Police.

title: 28 arrested with drugs in special operation at coastal areas in Colombo
byline: A total of 28 individuals, including two women, have been arrested during an anti-drug operation carried out by the Coastal Police in three separate coastal areas of Colombo.

title: Passport crisis: Immigration officers claim higher-ups concealed actual situation from Minister
byline: The Sri Lanka Immigration and Emigration Officers’ Association has issued a statement addressing the ongoing passport crisis in the country, citing administrative mismanagement and a lack of adequate planning as key contributors for the issue.

title: Sri Lanka’s official reserves up by 7.9% in October
byline: Sri Lanka’s official reserve assets have significantly increased to USD 6.46 billion in October 2024, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: More houses built under Indian grant handed over to beneficiaries
byline: The High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka Santosh Jha has inaugurated and handed over the Thiththavelkiwla Model Village in Monaragala to 24 beneficiary families.

title: Report on rice and paddy stocks handed over to President
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Trade M.M. Naimuddin today (07) handed over the report prepared by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) on rice and paddy stocks in the country to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.
